intro: Heteropterys aenea, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine, silvery hairs. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are usually pink or red and bloom in clusters. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and vibrant floral displays.
